Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Number/min
Synopsis Determine the smallest of two numeric values.
Function &T <: num min(&T <: num n, &T <: num m)
Description The smallest of two numbers. The type of the result is the same as the type of the smallest argument.
Examples 
rascal>import Number;
ok
rascal>min(12, 13);
int: 12
rascal>min(12, -13);
int: -13
rascal>min(3.14, 4);
num: 3.14
Questions
Question [1].
The type of min(-7, 16) is

Question [2].
The type of min(-7, -12.73147700151514400) is

Question [3].
The type of min(-10.35182074543213600, 15.78545961849136800) is

Question [4]. 
min(-13.468477764553803600, -18) ==
